column1: <body class="post-template-default single single-post postid-3439 single-format-standard singular two-column right-sidebar">

• TheDataPoint
  • Engineering
  • 8 Features of ng-repeat

• TheDataPoint
  • Engineering
  • 8 Features of ng-repeat
<article id="post-3439" class="post-3439 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-engineering">
ng-repeat is my favorite of all the core AngularJS directives. A huge amount of front end programming time goes into displaying lists of things in helpful ways and ng-repeat helps make that easier
column2: but it’s also filled to the brim with gotchas. Even worse
column3: when something doesn’t work it fails silently and you’re left to figure out why your list isn’t sorting or filtering correctly.

column1: Because of these gotchas
column2: I put together a presentation last year for our Angular-Philly meetup titled
column3: 14 Slides on ng-repeat. I frequently refer back to it to check my syntax so I figured it might be a useful blog post. Here are 8 features of ng-repeat!

column1: Plain ng-repeat
Model

<div id="crayon-5c0066297ec70392932225" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-github crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover" style="margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; margin-left: 50px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; height: auto;">

<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea wrap="soft" class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly="" style="tab-size: 4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; z-index: 0; opacity: 0; overflow: hidden;">$scope.names = [‘Ben’
<div class="crayon-main" style="position: relative; z-index: 1; overflow: hidden;">
$scope.names = [‘Ben’
Template

<div id="crayon-5c0066297ec7d337904052" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-github crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover" style="margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; margin-left: 50px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; height: auto;">

<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea wrap="soft" class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly="" style="tab-size: 4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; z-index: 0; opacity: 0; overflow: hidden;"><ul>
<div class="crayon-main" style="position: relative; z-index: 1; overflow: hidden;">

1
2
3

<ul>
  <li ng-repeat=”name in names”>{{name}}</li>
</ul>
View

Very simple. We have an array of strings and we’re creating an unordered list and populating each list item with a string from the names array. The data is bound to $scope and Angular keeps the model and the view consistent.
track by
Model

<div id="crayon-5c0066297ec81232163935" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-github crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover" style="margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; margin-left: 50px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; height: auto;">

<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea wrap="soft" class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly="" style="tab-size: 4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; z-index: 0; opacity: 0; overflow: hidden;">$scope.names = [‘Ben’
<div class="crayon-main" style="position: relative; z-index: 1; overflow: hidden;">
$scope.names = [‘Ben’
Template

<div id="crayon-5c0066297ec85943946496" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-github crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover" style="margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; margin-left: 50px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; height: auto;">

<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea wrap="soft" class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly="" style="tab-size: 4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; z-index: 0; opacity: 0; overflow: hidden;"><ul>
<div class="crayon-main" style="position: relative; z-index: 1; overflow: hidden;">

1
2
3

<ul>
  <li ng-repeat=”name in names track by $index”>{{name}}</li>
</ul>
View
Around Angular 1.3 they started requiring track by for any list that may include duplicate values. Using track by also speeds up list changes significantly. If you don’t use track by in this case
column2: you get the error: Duplicates in a repeater are not allowed

column1: filter
Model

<div id="crayon-5c0066297ec89062463423" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-github crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover" style="margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; margin-left: 50px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; height: auto;">

<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea wrap="soft" class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly="" style="tab-size: 4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; z-index: 0; opacity: 0; overflow: hidden;">$scope.names = [‘Ben’
<div class="crayon-main" style="position: relative; z-index: 1; overflow: hidden;">
$scope.names = [‘Ben’
Template

<div id="crayon-5c0066297ec8d218407072" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-github crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover" style="margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; margin-left: 50px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; height: auto;">

<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea wrap="soft" class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly="" style="tab-size: 4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; z-index: 0; opacity: 0; overflow: hidden;"><ul>
<li ng-repeat=”name in names | filter:searchBox track by $index”>
<div class="crayon-main" style="position: relative; z-index: 1; overflow: hidden;">

1
2
3
4
5
6

<ul>
  <input type=”text” ng-model=”searchBox”>
  <li ng-repeat=”name in names | filter:searchBox track by $index”>
    {{name}}
  </li>
</ul>
View
By binding the filter to the searchBox
column2: you can create an easy way to find the list item you want. A common mistake is to put the filter after the track by like this. name in names track by $index | filter:searchBox. Don’t do it!

column1: object
Model

<div id="crayon-5c0066297ec91743739835" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-github crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover" style="margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; margin-left: 50px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; height: auto;">

<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea wrap="soft" class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly="" style="tab-size: 4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; z-index: 0; opacity: 0; overflow: hidden;">$scope.statuses = {"Ben": true
<div class="crayon-main" style="position: relative; z-index: 1; overflow: hidden;">
$scope.statuses = {"Ben": true
column2: "Nate": true
column3: "Austin": false};

column1: Template

<div id="crayon-5c0066297ec94480022075" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-github crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover" style="margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; margin-left: 50px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; height: auto;">

<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea wrap="soft" class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly="" style="tab-size: 4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 21px !important; z-index: 0; opacity: 0; overflow: hidden;"><ul>

1
2
3
4
5

<ul>
  <li ng-repeat=”(key
column2:
value) in statuses”>
    {{key}} {{value}}
  </li>
</ul>

column1: View
Yes
column2: you can iterate over objects with ng-repeat
column3: but don’t do it! You’ll regret it. All the cool stuff like sorting and filtering either doesn’t work or gets way more complicated. If you’re iterating over an object with ng-repeat

column1: array of objects

2

4
5

<ul>
      <li><input type="text" ng-model="searchBox"/></li>
          <li ng-repeat="user in users | filter:searchBox:user.name | orderBy:’name’">
              {{user.name}}
              <select ng-model="user.status" ng-options="status for status in statuses"></select>
          </li>
  </ul>
View
Don’t forget the orderBy value has to be a string. Don’t do this! ng-repeat="user in users | filter:searchBox:user.name | orderBy:name"
